overview: Jerry Ryan wanders aimlessly around New York after giving up his Nebraskan law practice. His wife asks for a divorce. He meets Gittel, a struggling dancer from Greenwich Village and they try to sort out their lives. An extended conversation piece with a static camera, but reflects the moral climate of the time.
tagline: A square from Nebraska? An off-beatnik from Greenwich Village?  It just didn't figure ... that they would ... that they could ... that they did!
title: Two for the Seesaw
